sentences.en: Birth rates are notoriously difficult to predict.
sentences.cn: 众所周知,出生率是很难预测的.

sentences.en: Civil court proceedings are notoriously slow.
sentences.cn: 民事诉讼程序的耗时长是无人不知的.

sentences.en: Could some of the deaths have been prevented in this notoriously high-risk area?
sentences.cn: 在这个众所周知的高危地区，有些死亡是否可以避免？

sentences.en: Derrida famously, notoriously, said "there is nothing outside the text," right? What he meant by that, of course, is that there's nothing but text.
sentences.cn: 德里达著名地，恶名昭彰地，说道，文本之外什么都没有“,是吧，当然，他意思就是说，需要考虑的只有文本。

sentences.en: Diplomats can be a notoriously unreliable and misleading source of information.
sentences.cn: 外交官可能会提供一些靠不住的误导性信息，这是众所周知的。

sentences.en: Doctors notoriously neglect their own health and fail to seek help when they should.
sentences.cn: 众所周知，医生不注意自身的健康，而且在应该求助时也不这么做。

sentences.en: He is notoriously indiscreet about his private life.
sentences.cn: 他在私生活方面的不检点是出了名的。

sentences.en: He worked mainly in New York City where living space is notoriously at a premium.
sentences.cn: 他主要在纽约市工作，那儿的住房出了名地昂贵。

sentences.en: Let us deal with the question of his notoriously Neanderthal attitude to women.
sentences.cn: 我们现在来说说他臭名昭著的、对女性态度粗鲁的问题。

sentences.en: Maps of the region are notoriously inaccurate.
sentences.cn: 众所周知,这一地区的地图都不太精确.

sentences.en: Professors are notoriously difficult to manage.
sentences.cn: 教授们很难管理是出了名的。

sentences.en: The television world was a notoriously fickle one.
sentences.cn: 电视圈是出了名的变化无常.

sentences.en: The train company is overstaffed and notoriously inefficient.
sentences.cn: 铁路公司冗员过多，工作效率出了名地低。
火车不准点是出了名的。

sentences.en: The weather here is notoriously fickle.
sentences.cn: 这里的天气出了名的变化无常。

sentences.en: The weather in Britain is notoriously changeable.
sentences.cn: 英国的天气易变是有名的.

sentences.en: Toddlers are notoriously antisocial when it comes to sharing toys.
sentences.cn: 众所周知，刚学会走路的孩子不愿和别人分享玩具。

words.tran_cn: 声名狼藉的，臭名昭著的
众所周知地；声名狼藉地；恶名昭彰地

trans.tran_cn: 恶名昭彰地，声名狼藉地，著名地，众所周知地
